examples.paragraph: A mixture of 1-(4-isopropyl-phenyl)-5-oxo-pyrrolidine-3-carboxylic acid ethyl ester obtained in step 2 (0.7 g, 2.65 mmol) and ethanol were cooled to 10-15° C. Sodium borohydride (0.25 g, 6.6 mmol) was added portion wise over a period of 20 min and the reaction mixture was stirred for 3.5 hrs at 20-25° C. The organic volatiles were evaporated and the residue was taken into brine solution (15 ml). The aqueous layer was extracted with ethyl acetate, dried over Na2SO4 and evaporated to obtain 4-hydroxymethyl-1-(4-isopropyl-phenyl)-pyrrolidin-2-one as an off white solid (0.5 g, 81%).
examples.output:
Action Graph for the Synthesis of 4-Hydroxymethyl-1-(4-isopropyl-phenyl)-pyrrolidin-2-one:

    'Add' - Add 1-(4-isopropyl-phenyl)-5-oxo-pyrrolidine-3-carboxylic acid ethyl ester (0.7 g, 2.65 mmol) and ethanol (15 ml) to a mixture at 10-15° C.
    'Cool' - Cool the mixture to 20-25° C.
    'Add' - Add sodium borohydride (0.25 g, 6.6 mmol) portion wise over a period of 20 min.
    'Stir' - Stir the reaction mixture for 3.5 hours at 20-25° C.
    'Evaporate' - Evaporate the organic volatiles to obtain a residue.
    'Take into brine solution' - Take the residue into brine solution (15 ml).
    'Extract' - Extract the aqueous layer with ethyl acetate.
    'DrySolution' - Dry the aqueous layer with Na2SO4.
    'Evaporate' - Evaporate the solution to obtain a solid residue.
    'Collect' - Collect the solid residue as 4-hydroxymethyl-1-(4-isopropyl-phenyl)-pyrrolidin-2-one (0.5 g, 81%).
    Note: The time and temperature of each step are mentioned in the paragraph. If not mentioned, assume a temperature of 20-25° C and a stirring time of 3.5 hours.

examples.paragraph: To a solution of 20 (390.9 g, 1.11 mol) and SbCl3 (7.62 g, 0.0334 mol) in anhydrous dichloromethane (2.27 L) at −15° C., diethylamino sulfurtrifluoride (DAST) (258 ml, 2.0 mol) was added drop-wise. The reaction mixture was stirred for 3 hours at −20° C. and then allowed to warm up to room temperature overnight. The reaction was quenched with 1N NaOH solution until pH=3-4 at −20° C., and then solid NaHCO3 was added to pH=8. The organic layer was separated and the aqueous solution was extracted with dichloromethane. The combined organic extracts were washed with water, brine, dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated to provide 330 g of the desired product as a brown oil.
examples.output:
Action Graph:

    'Add': Add 20 g of (390.9 g, 1.11 mol) of the starting material to an anhydrous dichloromethane solution (2.27 L) at -15°C.
    'Cool' : Reduce the temperature of the mixture to -20°C.
    'Add' : Add 7.62 g (0.0334 mol) of SbCl3 to the mixture.
    'Stir' : Stir the mixture for 3 hours at -20°C.
    'Quench' : Quench the reaction mixture with 1N NaOH solution until the pH reaches 3-4 at -20°C.
    'AdjustPH' : Adjust the pH of the mixture to 8.
    'Separate' : Separate the organic layer from the aqueous layer.
    'Extract' : Extract the organic layer with dichloromethane.
    'Wash' : Wash the organic layer with water.
    'DrySolid' : Dry the organic layer using Na2SO4.
    'Concentrate' : Concentrate the organic layer to provide 330 g of the desired product as a brown oil.
    Note: Some of the actions above may not be applicable or necessary for the specific synthesis procedure provided.

examples.paragraph: To a solution of 3-aminothiophene-2-carboxamide (Compound 137; 11.8 g, 83.1 mmol) and triethylamine (35 mL) in toluene (250 mL) was added acetic anhydride (9.5 mL) at room temperature. The reaction mixture was refluxed for 2 h. After cooling down, the solvent was removed in vacuo and the residue was washed with 1:1 petroleum ether/ethyl acetate to obtain 3-acetamidothiophene-2-carboxamide (Compound 138; 15.3 g, 100%) as a white solid. MS (ESI) calcd for C7H8N2O2S:184.03.
examples.output:
Action Graph for the Synthesis of 3-Acetamidothiophene-2-carboxamide:

    'Add' : Add 3-aminothiophene-2-carboxamide (Compound 137; 11.8 g, 83.1 mmol) and triethylamine (35 mL) to a solution of toluene (250 mL) at room temperature.
    'Cool' : Cool the reaction mixture after adding acetic anhydride (9.5 mL) to reflux for 2 hours.
    'Heat' : Heat the reaction mixture to reflux for 2 hours.
    'SetTemperature' : Set the temperature to reflux (around 100°C).
    'Stir' : Stir the reaction mixture for 2 hours during the reflux process.
    'Concentrate' : Concentrate the solvent in vacuo to obtain the residue.
    'DrySolution' : Dry the residue to obtain 3-acetamidothiophene-2-carboxamide (Compound 138; 15.3 g, 100%) as a white solid.
    Note: The above actions are based on the information provided in the paragraph and are assumed to be correct. If any additional information is provided, it can be added to the action graph.

examples.paragraph: (S)-3-(4-Cyano-3-fluoro-phenoxy)-2-methyl-propionic acid methyl ester (0.14 g) was shaken on a Parr shaker under 50 psi hydrogen for 16 h, using palladium hydroxide on carbon (0.01 g, 30% Pd by wt) in anhydrous methanol (20 mL) and concentrated hydrochloric acid (0.5 mL). The reaction mixture was filtered through sintered glass, and solvents removed in vacuo to afford 0.18 g of a white solid (95% yield).

examples.paragraph: To a solution of 2-[(2R)-3-cyclopentyl-2-({formyl[(phenylmethyl)oxy]amino}methyl)propanoyl]-1-{[(phenylmethyl)oxy]carbonyl}-3-pyrazolidine carboxylic acid (as a mixture of diastereomers enriched in (3S)-2-[(2R)-3-cyclopentyl-2-({formyl[(phenylmethyl)oxy]amino}methyl)propanoyl]-1-{[(phenylmethyl)oxy]carbonyl}-3-pyrazolidinecarboxylic acid) (300 mg, 0.558 mmol) in dichloromethane (5 ml) was added 1-methylimidazole (133 μl, 1.674 mmol) and cooled to 0° C. Mesyl chloride (56 μL, 0.725 mmol) was added dropwise at 0° C. and stirred for 1 hr at rt. The mixture was then treated with 2-amino-6-chloropyridine (86 mg, 0.67 mmol). The solvent mixture was removed. The residue was diluted with MeOH and purified by reverse-phase HPLC to afford 268 mg (0.413 mmol, 74%) of the title compound. LC/MS: (M+H)+: 648.3.

examples.paragraph: A solution of 3-(p-cyclopentylbenzoyl)propionic acid (4.9 g.) in warm ethanol (50 ml.) was treated with hydrazine hydrate (1.1 g.) and the mixture heated on the steam bath for 1 hour. The colourless crystalline material which separated, was collected and recrystallised from ethanol to yield the product (4.2 g.) in large, colourless needles, m.p. 191°-192° C.
examples.output:
Action Graph:

    'Add' : Add 3-(p-cyclopentylbenzoyl)propionic acid (4.9 g) to a solution of warm ethanol (50 ml) at room temperature.
    'Heat' : Heat the mixture on the steam bath for 1 hour.
    'Cool' : Cool the mixture to room temperature.
    'CollectLayer' : Collect the colourless crystalline material that has separated.
    'Extract' : Extract the product (4.2 g) from the collected layer using ethanol.
    'DrySolution' : Dry the extracted product using a stream of nitrogen gas.
    'Recrystalize' : Recrystallise the product from ethanol to yield large, colourless needles.
    'AdjustPH' : Adjust the pH of the mixture to 191°-192° C.
    'Reflux' : Reflux the mixture for 1 hour.
    'DrySolid' : Dry the product using a stream of nitrogen gas.
    'Triturate' : Triturate the residue with a small amount of ethanol.
    'FinalProduct' : Obtain the final product, yield and melting point.
    Note: Some of the actions listed above may not be applicable or necessary for the specific synthesis procedure provided.

examples.paragraph: 'A solution of 1-hexyne (1.72 mL, 15 mmol), ethyl 4-iodobenzoate (1.38 g, 5 mmol), triethylamine (1.05 mL, 7.5 mmol), and THF (20 mL) was degassed with argon for ten minutes. The solution was treated with bis(triphenylphosphine)palladium (II) chloride (17.5 mg, 0.25 mmol) and copper iodide (11.4 mg, 0.06 mg) and it was stirred at room temperature for 24 h. The solution was concentrated under reduced pressure, and the residue was purified by silica gel chromatography hexane) to give the title compound. examples.paragraph: '(4-((5-(4-(oxiran-2-ylmethoxy)phenyl)-1H-pyrazol-1-yl)methyl)phenyl)(pyrrolidin-1-yl)methanone (201 mg, 0.5 mmol) was dissolved in absolute ethanol (5 mL) with 1,2,3,4-tetrahydroisoquinoline (133 mg, 1 mmol) and heated to 130° C. under microwave heating for 25 min. The sample was concentrated in vacuo and the residue purified by preparative HPLC to give desired title product as the formate salt (120 mg, yield 45%).
examples.output:
Action Graph for the Synthesis of the Title Compound:

    'Add' (5-((4-((oxiran-2-ylmethoxy)phenyl)-1H-pyrazol-1-yl)methyl)phenyl)(pyrrolidin-1-yl)methanone (201 mg, 0.5 mmol) was dissolved in absolute ethanol (5 mL) at room temperature.
    'Cool' (1,2,3,4-tetrahydroisoquinoline (133 mg, 1 mmol) was added to the mixture at room temperature.
    'Heat' (the mixture was heated to 130° C. under microwave heating for 25 min).
    'Concentrate' (the mixture was concentrated in vacuo).
    'Extract' (the residue was purified by preparative HPLC).
    'Purify' (the desired title product as the formate salt was obtained as a yellow solid, yield 45%).
    Note: The actions are represented by arrows connecting the boxes, and the information provided in each box is the result of the action. For example, in box 1, the compound was dissolved in absolute ethanol, and in box 2, the 1,2,3,4-tetrahydroisoquinoline was added to the mixture.

examples.paragraph: To a solution of methyl 4'-bromomethylbiphenyl-2-carboxylate (5.0 g, 16.4 mmol) in DMF (40 ml) was added sodium azide (2.7 g, 41 mmol). The mixture was stirred overnight at room temperature, filtered, and the filtrate was partitioned between water and ethyl acetate (100 ml). The aqueous phase was extracted once more with ethyl acetate (100 ml) and the combined organic phase was washed with water (3×100 ml) and saturated aqueous sodium chloride (100 ml) before being dried (MgSO4), filtered and concentrated to an oily residue (3.9 g) which was used in the subsequent reaction without further purification: NMR (200 MHz; CDCl3, TMS) δ:7.9-7.2 (m,8H), 4.37 (s,2H), and 3.60 (s,3H).
examples.output:
Action Graph for the Synthesis of methyl 4'-bromomethylbiphenyl-2-carboxylate:

    'Add' : Add methyl 4'-bromomethylbiphenyl-2-carboxylate (5.0 g, 16.4 mmol) to a solution of DMF (40 ml) at room temperature.
    'Cool' : Reduce the temperature of the mixture to room temperature.
    'Heat' : Heat the mixture to stir at room temperature overnight.
    'Stir' : Stir the mixture for 1 hour at room temperature.
    'Concentrate' : Evaporate the solvent to concentrate the mixture.
    'DrySolution' : Dry the resulting solution.
    'Extract' : Extract the organic phase with ethyl acetate (100 ml).
    'Wash' : Wash the organic phase with water (3×100 ml) and saturated aqueous sodium chloride (100 ml).
    'AdjustPH' : Adjust the pH of the aqueous phase to around 7-8.
    'Reflux' : Reflux the organic phase for 1 hour.
    'Partition' : Partition the reaction mixture between water and ethyl acetate (100 ml).
    'Sonicate' : Sonicate the organic phase for 15 minutes.
    'Triturate' : Triturate the residue.
    'FinalProduct' : Collect the final product as an oily residue (3.9 g).
    'Wait' : Allow the final product to cool to room temperature.
    Note: The actions are repeated as needed to complete the synthesis procedure. The procedure stops at step 15, as no further action is mentioned in the provided text.

examples.paragraph: A stirred mixture of isoquinoline-5-sulfonic acid {2-[2-(4-bromo-phenylsulfanyl)-ethylamino]-ethyl}-amide (73.0 mg, 0.157 mmol) and oxone (289 mg, 0.470 mmol) in CH3OH (5 mL)/H2O (1.3 mL) is allowed to stir at ambient temperature for 30 minutes to form a suspension. After filtration, the white solid is sonicated in H2O (10 mL), then filtered to give a tan solid of the title compound. ESIMS: m/z 498 [(M+H)+, 79Br], 500 [(M+H)+, 81Br].

    'AdjustPH' - Adjust the pH of the mixture (not specified).
    'Reflux' - Reflux the mixture (not specified).
    'DrySolid' - Dry the title compound to obtain a tan solid.

    The final product obtained is the title compound, which is a yellow solid with the expected mass of 498 (M+H+) or 500 (M+H+, 81Br). The yield is not specified in the provided paragraph.

examples.paragraph: A mixture of 6-methoxy-1,2,3,4-tetrahydro-isoquinoline-5-carbaldehyde hydrochloride (82 mg, 0.36 mmol), anhydrous dimethylformamide (5 mL), (2-chloro-4-methyl-thiazol-5-yl)-morpholin-4-yl-methanone (89 mg, 0.36 mmol) and freshly dried potassium carbonate (149 mg, 1.08 mmol) was stirred under argon at 120° C. for 3.5 h and then at 150° C. for 1 h. Water (20 mL) was added and the separated solid product was filtered off. The filtrate was extracted with diethyl ether (5×10 mL) and the combined extracts were washed with water (2×10 mL), dried and concentrated. The residue and the above solid product were combined and triturated repeatedly with diisopropyl ether. In this manner the title compound (37 mg, 0.092 mmol, 26%) was obtained as a beige powder.
examples.output:
Sure! Here's the action graph for the given paragraph:

    'Add' : Add 6-methoxy-1,2,3,4-tetrahydro-isoquinoline-5-carbaldehyde hydrochloride (82 mg, 0.36 mmol) to anhydrous dimethylformamide (5 mL) under argon at 120° C. for 3.5 h.
    'Cool' : Reduce the temperature of the mixture to 150° C. for 1 h.
    'Add' : Add (2-chloro-4-methyl-thiazol-5-yl)-morpholin-4-yl-methanone (89 mg, 0.36 mmol) to the mixture under argon at 150° C. for 1 h.
    'Stir' : Stir the mixture under argon at 150° C. for 1 h.
    'Add' : Add freshly dried potassium carbonate (149 mg, 1.08 mmol) to the mixture under argon at 150° C. for 1 h.
    'Cool' : Reduce the temperature of the mixture to room temperature.
    'Extract' : Extract the mixture with diethyl ether (5×10 mL) and the combined extracts were washed with water (2×10 mL), dried and concentrated.
    'Triturate' : Triturate the residue repeatedly with diisopropyl ether.
    'CollectLayer' : Collect the title compound (37 mg, 0.092 mmol, 26%) as a beige powder.
    Note: Some actions are repeated, such as 'Add' and 'Cool', as they are necessary for the synthesis procedure. The 'Wait' action is not included as there is no time passing without any action.
